name: Bangkok Living

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wowee! When we arrived we stayed at the usual accommendations of those familiar names of the hotel chain industry, but right from the get go you will feel as if you are in your lux condo in downtown Chicago footsteps from everything! At first I was hesitant from fraying from the regular posh comforts of those other good places, but this place was recommended by my wife’s family who are local in Bangkok, so they know what the best deals local “thai prices” are and where to avoid the hustle all those touristy spots bring to the table. First we stayed at the one bedroom unit. At first entrance of the room you feel the modern posh decor. The refrigerator is one that three times the size of any hotel I’ve been in! There’s a kitchen prep area which is good for microwaving food. The bathroom has good hot water at push of a button. The king bed/ Sealy high end is better than most Asian hotels because it’s not as hard, We had a very good nights sleep! The cabinets to store cloths can stow easy about three weeks of cloths for two people! The room service is 24/7 and you could order from the local fair and eat very good, as well as see great views of from the balcony of the room!Just four blks from the new train system that connects you to everything! And across the street from a bus stop and taxi pickup area. The hotel is family owned so you’re not dealing with people of chain hotels who just need a job this is their passion, life. Come out to see for yourself, it’s only been open for less than one year!
reviews.title: wow! Great plush 4 or 5 star hotel living at a lower rate of an apartment!

reviews.text: As a regular visitor to Bangkok, this is the first time i have committed to comment on my accommodation. And only because it was so good!!! A new building in a bangkok suburb on a main road, which gives easy access to metered taxis everywhere (very cheap) the building which is new has all the latest mod cons,pool, Gym, great security,air con, wi-fi ect Rooms are big bright and fresh, kettle, microwave ect, new quality bed, lounge, glass table and chairs. Great shower and bathroom in fact whether you stay long term or just for a couple of days, it offers fantastic value. close to the biggest major hospital in Bangkok. in fact its central location allows you to catch a taxi for less than a 100 TBHT to Nana or Khoa San Rd.
reviews.title: A home away from home

reviews.text: Staff speak great english and are extremely helpful, seven eleven store opposite,and 2 little thai bars within 50 meters of front entrance, (60 TBHT for big bottle of beer) All in all a great little home from home for less than a 1000 TBHT a night
reviews.title: Ideal location! Great Accommodations!

reviews.text: I stayed three weeks at Bangkok Living with my best friend and we absolutely loved the location of this hotel! You are close enough to all the main attractions yet this apartment/studio complex is located in the heart of a real Thai neighborhood providing a variety of delicious authentic Thai food. The accommodations and amenities were perfect at this hotel. WiFi internet, great showers, comfortable beds, and great view of Bangkok from my room.
reviews.title: It was an amazing experience, there is nothing negative I could say about this place.

reviews.text: Based on the reviews here on Tripadvisor, I booked myself into Bangkok Living for a week earlier this year. There's nothing much I can add to the other reviews - the place is exactly as described - clean, modern, spacious. There's a small kitchenette area with a fair sized frig, a TV with several channels (loved watching the Asian cook shows!), nice big armoire, and - for my purposes - even a clothes drying rack. I liked to wash and rinse my clothes every night since it is hot and dusty in Bangkok, and it was wonderful to be able to spread my wet washed things on the rack and have they dry overnight. One of my concerns was safety, this is a very safe area. I walked to and from the BTS station (3 blocks) at all times of the day or night and always felt safe. The hosts were as described - very friendly and accommodating. The security people were the friendliest and helped with my arrival and departure taxis. Very secure, clean, BIG room, friendly people - what's not to like? :) Highly recommend. Would stay there again.
reviews.title: A Super Find in Bangkok
Excellent i will be back
reviews.text: Can't recommend this place enough. Clean large rooms with new furniture and soft large bed. Big TV, fridge, large bathrooms. Rooms are serviced very well everything cleaned down with fresh sheets and towels. Joo looked after me like my second mum as i used this hotel to recover from surgery at Yahnee, checked on me to make sure i was okay and if i needed anything, wrote all the addresses i needed in thai and was just generally a delight to be around. I will definitely be back to stay :)

I lived in Bangkok Living Apartments from August 2010-July 2011, eleven months in total. I highly, highly recommend it as a short-term or long-term home-base in Bangkok. I looked at over 30 apartments before finding my home at Bangkok Living. Save yourself the frustrations of apartment hunting and live here from the start. I could write a book about wonderful this place is, but I will try to simplify my praises:
reviews.title: Lived here for 11 months and LOVED every minute.

reviews.text: 1. The owners: Joo and Sirachai are the kindest and most helpful ‘landlords’ imaginable. They are eager to meet residents requests and needs. Furthermore, they offer a wealth of knowledge about the local area, Bangkok in general, and Thai culture. I consider Joo my ‘Bangkok mother’ for she always looked out for me during my near-year long stay. Tong, the property manager, was always quick to help me with minor maintenance issues and my keycard forgetfulness.
reviews.title: Simplicity with great service... a wonderful vacation stay.

reviews.text: 2. The building: Bangkok Living is very, very, very new. The building is beautifully constructed and immaculately maintained. I lived in a 6th floor Studio room which was spacious, well-planned and very comfortable. The furniture is new, the bed is super comfortable and the floor plan wisely utilizes the space. Despite living here for 11 months and transitioning from a very-American sized house, I never felt cramped. There is a small kitchenette which is more than adequate, complete with a microwave, refrigerator and full-sized sink (Street food is so cheap and delicious you don’t need a cook top). The view from my balcony afforded me panoramas of the downtown Bangkok skyline. The building also has a gorgeous pool complete with outdoor shower and sunning chairs. There is a small but well-appointed gym (exercise bike, elliptical, treadmill, and sit-up bench) that overlooks the pool area and has great air-con. Overall this building has a very modern and luxe feel.
reviews.title: Brand new with excellent service

reviews.text: I couldn't have asked more from my accomodation during my stay than what Bangkok Living provided. Everything was top notch.
reviews.title: Perfect stay in Bangkok

reviews.text: The room was clean and cozy, and all the furniture seemingly new. Big comfortable bed, Fridge, Microwave and TV, as well as good Air Con. Also, the room had a private balcony, which was a great addition. On the 4th floor they have a beautiful outside pool with sun chairs to relax and enjoy.
reviews.title: The perfect place to stay - we could not ask for more.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great as well. The immediate neighborhood is silent, but already after some minutes walk you'll find every kind of services you'll need on the Pradipat Road. When you wish to travel further around the city, the Skytrain (BTS) station of Saphan Kwai is only 15-20 minutes walk from the apartment. Also the metro station, train station, and Kiak Kai boat pier are all conveniently close.
reviews.title: You simply can't wish better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last but not least, the owners and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful, ready to assist you the best they can. I cannot recommend this place enough.
reviews.title: In this apartment you will forget your troubles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived at Bangkok Living, we were thrilled. The longer we stayed there, the more we liked it. The owners are extremely friendly and thoughtful, and eager to be of help. The rooms are clean and modern and furnished with everything you need to have a great stay. We stayed for one week, and then extended our stay for a second week.
reviews.title: SImply great

reviews.text: I stayed here with my boyfriend and parents for 5 nights on the back of other reviews on this site and we weren't disappointed. From the moment I enquired about a reservation, Joo, the owner, couldn't have been more helpful, and this continued throughout our stay. We wanted to take an overnight trip to Kanchanaburi and she went to great lengths researching all the travel options (times/prices), booked the taxi for us and even called during the day to check everything was going well - we couldn't have felt more looked after. When back in Bangkok, it was great knowing she was there to answer any queries.
reviews.title: Superbly comfortable with the most helpful owner ever!

reviews.text: The apartments themselves are brand new and very comfortable. Great mattresses, free wifi, cable TV, aircon, really good powerful showers. We booked the apartments over a hotel because we wanted some self-catering options (the rooms have a full-size fridge and a microwave). The pool was also great to use after a sweaty day of sightseeing.
reviews.title: Loved staying here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only point to realise is that the apartments are located slightly out of the main tourist areas. In our opinion this was a positive thing, not being accosted by a tuk tuk driver every time we left the building. It was always possible to grab a taxi straight away which cost about 100 bhat (£2) to the city centre.
reviews.title: A great place with extremely helpfull owners

reviews.text: We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Good to stay for foreigners

reviews.text: I would highly recommend Bangkok Living to visitors to Bangkok. Not only are the rooms and facilities modern and comfortable, but the real joy of this apartment is the genuine and friendly owners and staff who really care about the people who stay here and go out of their way to help new visitors get oriented and comfortable. Both of the owners speak excellent English and were exceedingly helpful with giving me tips about the neighborhood and the city and also constantly checking on me to make sure that everything was going okay. I don’t think I have ever felt so welcomed when moving into an apartment in a new city!
reviews.title: A great place to stay

description: Bangkok Living is a brand new apartment situated on the main road in bangkok's exclusive residential area just a ride away from the heart of Bangkok's Business and Entertainment centers. It is suitable for both short stay and long stay vacation. Clean and secure, the apartment is well maintained and highly secured with CCTV and 24 hours security guard service and key card access system.
